meanings.definition: An advantage or benefit gained from a job or situation.
meanings.sent1: Getting free coffee at work is a nice perk.
meanings.sent2: Employee discounts are a common perk in many companies.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected bonus was a great perk to the job offer.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude was a perk that helped her stand out.
meanings.sent5: The flexible work hours were a valuable perk for the employees.

meanings.definition: To become more lively or cheerful.
meanings.sent1: After a good night's sleep, she began to perk up.
meanings.sent2: The music helped perk up the party atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The joke made everyone perk up and laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sunshine peeking through the clouds seemed to perk up the day.
meanings.sent5: A cup of tea can often perk you up when you're feeling tired.

meanings.definition: To raise or lift up slightly.
meanings.sent1: She used a pillow to perk up her posture while sitting.
meanings.sent2: The tailor offered to perk up the hem of the dress.
meanings.sent3: Adding a touch of color can perk up a room's decor.
meanings.sent4: The chef used fresh herbs to perk up the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent5: A quick stretch can help perk up your energy levels.
